00041 #include "config.h"

00043 #include <sys/types.h>
00044 #include <sys/param.h>
00045 #include <sys/socket.h>
00046 #include <sys/wait.h>
00047 #include <sys/ipc.h>
00048 #include <sys/sem.h>
00049 
00050 #include <unistd.h>
00051 #include <err.h>
00052 #include <stdio.h>

00056 #include <errno.h>
00057 #include <libcfs/util/string.h>

00059 #include "gssd.h"
00060 #include "err_util.h"
00061 #include "gss_util.h"
00062 #include "krb5_util.h"
00063 #include "lsupport.h"
00064 
00065 char pipefs_dir[PATH_MAX] = GSSD_PIPEFS_DIR;
00066 char pipefs_nfsdir[PATH_MAX] = GSSD_PIPEFS_DIR;
00067 char keytabfile[PATH_MAX] = GSSD_DEFAULT_KEYTAB_FILE;
00068 char ccachedir[PATH_MAX] = GSSD_DEFAULT_CRED_DIR;
00069 int  use_memcache = 0;
00070 int  lgssd_mutex_downcall = -1;
00071 
00072 static int lgssd_create_mutex(int *semid)
00073 {
00074         int             id;
00075         int             arg;
00076 
00077         id = semget(IPC_PRIVATE, 1, IPC_CREAT);
00078         if (id == -1) {
00079                 printerr(0, "semget: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00080                 return -1;
00081         }
00082 
00083         arg = 1;
00084         if (semctl(id, 0, SETVAL, arg) != 0) {
00085                 printerr(0, "semctl: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00086                 semctl(id, 1, IPC_RMID, arg);
00087                 return -1;
00088         }
00089 
00090         *semid = id;
00091         return 0;
00092 }
00093 
00094 void lgssd_init_mutexs(void)
00095 {
00096         if (lgssd_create_mutex(&lgssd_mutex_downcall)) {
00097                 printerr(0, "can't create downcall mutex\n");
00098                 exit(1);
00099         }
00100 }
00101 
00102 void lgssd_fini_mutexs(void)
00103 {
00104         int     arg = 0;
00105 
00106         if (lgssd_mutex_downcall != -1)
00107                 semctl(lgssd_mutex_downcall, 1, IPC_RMID, arg);
00108 }
00109 
00110 void lgssd_mutex_get(int semid)
00111 {
00112         struct sembuf   op[1] = { {0, -1, SEM_UNDO} };
00113         int             rc;
00114 
00115         rc = semop(semid, op, 1);
00116         if (rc != 0) {
00117                 printerr(0, "exit on mutex_get err %d: %s\n",
00118                          rc, strerror(errno));
00119                 exit(1);
00120         }
00121 }
00122 
00123 void lgssd_mutex_put(int semid)
00124 {
00125         struct sembuf   op[1] = { {0, 1, 0} };
00126         int             rc;
00127 
00128         rc = semop(semid, op, 1);
00129         if (rc != 0) {
00130                 printerr(0, "ignore mutex_put err %d: %s\n",
00131                          rc, strerror(errno));
00132         }
00133 }
00134 
00135 static void lgssd_cleanup(void)
00136 {
00137         pid_t   child_pid;
00138 
00139         /* make sure all children finished */
00140         while (1) {
00141                 child_pid = waitpid(-1, NULL, 0);
00142                 if (child_pid < 0)
00143                         break;
00144 
00145                 printerr(3, "cleanup: child %d terminated\n", child_pid);
00146         }
00147 
00148         lgssd_fini_mutexs();
00149 
00150         /* destroy krb5 machine creds */
00151         gssd_destroy_krb5_machine_creds();
00152 }
00153 
00154 void
00155 sig_die(int signal)
00156 {
00157         printerr(1, "exiting on signal %d\n", signal);
00158         lgssd_cleanup();
00159         exit(1);
00160 }
00161 
00162 void
00163 sig_hup(int signal)
00164 {
00165         /* don't exit on SIGHUP */
00166         printerr(1, "Received SIGHUP... Ignoring.\n");
00167         return;
00168 }
00169 
00170 static void
00171 usage(char *progname)
00172 {
00173         fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s [-f] [-v] [-p pipefsdir] [-k keytab] [-d ccachedir]\n",
00174                 progname);
00175         exit(1);
00176 }
00177 
00178 int
00179 main(int argc, char *argv[])
00180 {
00181         int fg = 0;
00182         int verbosity = 0;
00183         int opt;
00184         extern char *optarg;
00185         char *progname;
00186 
00187         while ((opt = getopt(argc, argv, "fvrmMp:k:d:")) != -1) {
00188                 switch (opt) {
00189                         case 'f':
00190                                 fg = 1;
00191                                 break;
00192                         case 'M':
00193                                 use_memcache = 1;
00194                                 break;
00195                         case 'v':
00196                                 verbosity++;
00197                                 break;
00198                         case 'p':
00199                                 strlcpy(pipefs_dir, optarg, sizeof(pipefs_dir));
00200                                 if (pipefs_dir[sizeof(pipefs_dir)-1] != '\0')
00201                                         errx(1, "pipefs path name too long");
00202                                 break;
00203                         case 'k':
00204                                 strlcpy(keytabfile, optarg, sizeof(keytabfile));
00205                                 if (keytabfile[sizeof(keytabfile)-1] != '\0')
00206                                         errx(1, "keytab path name too long");
00207                                 break;
00208                         case 'd':
00209                                 strlcpy(ccachedir, optarg, sizeof(ccachedir));
00210                                 if (ccachedir[sizeof(ccachedir)-1] != '\0')
00211                                         errx(1, "ccachedir path name too long");
00212                                 break;
00213                         default:
00214                                 usage(argv[0]);
00215                                 break;
00216                 }
00217         }
00218 
00219         if ((progname = strrchr(argv[0], '/')))
00220                 progname++;
00221         else
00222                 progname = argv[0];
00223 
00224         initerr(progname, verbosity, fg);
00225 
00226         if (gssd_check_mechs() != 0)
00227                 errx(1, "Problem with gssapi library");
00228 
00229         if (gssd_get_local_realm())
00230                 errx(1, "get local realm");
00231 
00232         if (!fg && daemon(0, 0) < 0)
00233                 errx(1, "fork");
00234 
00235         /* This should be checked _after_ daemon(), because we need to own
00236          * the undo-able semaphore by this process
00237          */
00238         gssd_init_unique(GSSD_CLI);
00239 
00240         /* Process keytab file and get machine credentials. This will modify
00241          * disk status so do it after we are sure we are the only instance
00242          */
00243         if (gssd_refresh_krb5_machine_creds())
00244                 return -1;
00245 
00246         signal(SIGINT, sig_die);
00247         signal(SIGTERM, sig_die);
00248         signal(SIGHUP, sig_hup);
00249 
00250 #if 0
00251         /* Determine Kerberos information from the kernel */
00252         gssd_obtain_kernel_krb5_info();
00253 #endif
00254 
00255         lgssd_init_mutexs();
00256 
00257         printerr(0, "lgssd initialized and ready to serve\n");
00258         lgssd_run();
00259 
00260         lgssd_cleanup();
00261         printerr(0, "lgssd exiting\n");
00262         return 0;
00263 }
